Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a woman. Her hair is parted in the middle. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Traces of a white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions. Head only, back missing.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 167, no.6 pl. 3.6.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.449) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.6, p. 167. no.6 (catalogue number)
